(1) Where an Application is preferred by an employer to the Court of Appeal, for

column2: the  issue  of  an  Order  in  the  nature  of  a  writ,  against  an  award  made  by  an
arbitrator under Section 17(1) or by an industrial court under Section 24, the
Court of Appeal shall entertain such Application upon furnishing a security
by such employer, in cash to the Commissioner-General, where such award
which is subject to such Application directs the payment of a sum of money to
the worker, of an amount equal to such sum.

column1: (2) The Commissioner-General shall cause to be deposited the sum as specified in
